siteMetadata.meetupHomepageHeadline: The JAMstack meetup a mile high.

events.name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - December
events.description:
Details TBA!

JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent.
You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. Can't make it out this month? No worries, we're streaming live to Twitch and YouTube!
https://www.twitch.tv/jamstackdenver/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkvjCJHilRhXoalNm9pNPYg

Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct

events.name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - September
events.description:
Come on out to hear our awesome talk and get a feel for the JAMstack with a live coding event this month!

First, Mike Roof will be presenting a lightning talk on improving performance of a D3 application using Web Workers.
Then, we'll begin an adventure in the JAMstack and show how easy it is to create a website and publish it live to the internet without any server-side work!

JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent. You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. Can't make it out this month? No worries, we're streaming live to Twitch and YouTube!
https://www.twitch.tv/jamstackdenver/
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkvjCJHilRhXoalNm9pNPYg

Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct

events.name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - August
events.description:
JAMstack Denver is back at Code Talent after taking the holiday week off in July.

We are excited to have Mike Duke present 'What the Svelte?' for a deep dive into the nitty-gritty of Svelte, another component based JS library. Shannon Moranetz will be giving a lightning talk on the impact of JavaScript in developing mobile applications.

Come by from 6 to 6:30 for networking, pizza and drinks, presentations from 6:30 to 7:45, and then some more networking/pizza/drinks!

JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Can't make it out this month? No worries, we're streaming live to Twitch and YouTube!
https://www.twitch.tv/events/aMLhP36aSNiUipW0rS8vLg
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkvjCJHilRhXoalNm9pNPYg

Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct

events.name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - Happy Hour - July
events.description:
JAMstack Denver is back with a twist! No presentations, just a chance to network with fellow JAMstackers and have a lot of fun! Due to the busy time-period surrounding the 4th of July, we will be having an informal happy hour this month at Ratio Beerworks from 6pm-8pm. If you haven't heard about the JAMstack or don't fully understand it, this is a great way to learn about it in an informal and chill setting. We love seeing people of all backgrounds and experience-levels come to each meetup and we hope to see as many of you there this month as possible! So come JAM with us on July 3rd at Ratio!

Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct

events.name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - June
events.description: JAMstack Denver is back! Our main presentation for June will be Developing for Scale on the Front End by Doug Whitney "What does scalability mean when building and delivering front-end applications? In this presentation, we’ll look at some of the typical challenges of scale that come with developing single page web apps and talk about how to avoid optimizing in the wrong direction." Sounds awesome, right? Zach Brooks will also be giving us a short presentation on his experience building a portfolio site with Gridsome - sweet! Come by from 6 to 6:30 for networking, pizza and drinks, presentations from 6:30 to 7:45, and then some more networking! JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent. You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct

events.name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - May
events.description: JAMstack Denver Vol. 2! Join us as Thomas Randolph presents a deep dive into Web Components, and Nick Teets takes us on a strange journey with esoteric languages. There will be pizza and refreshments. Agenda: 6 - 6:20 - Pizza, refreshments and networking. 6:20 - 6:30 - Announcements and What's New in the JAMstack. 6:30 - 7:15 - 'Web Components: A Whole New World' w/ Thomas Randolph. 7:15 - 7:30 - 'Pardon My French, or the Exoteric Explanation of Esoteric Programming Languages' w/ Nick Teets. 7:30 - 8 - Networking. JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent. You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct

events.name: JAMstack Denver Meetup - April
events.description: Our inaugural meetup! Join us as Gabe Greenfield presents a primer on the JAMstack, and Anna Smolentzov gives a lightning talk on internet censorship. There will be pizza and refreshments. Agenda: 6 - 6:20 - Pizza, refreshments and networking. 6:20 - 6:30 - Announcements. 6:30 - 7:15 - Intro to JAMstack w/ Gabe Greenfield. 7:15 - 7:30 - Government Internet Censorship 101 w/ Anna Smolentzov. 7:30 - 8 - Networking. JAMstack Denver is hosted at Code Talent. You can find us at 3412 Blake Street from 6ish to 8ish on the first Wednesdays of each month. Code Talent is located just a few blocks from the 38th and Blake RTD station. Please read our Code of Conduct below: https://www.meetup.com/JAMstack-Denver/pages/28543529/JAMstack_Denver_Code_of_Conduct

whatIsJAMstackTextBlock.html:
What is the JAMstack ?

It's Javascript, APIs, and Markup.

An explosive mix between "old-fashioned" static sites and recent technologies such as React and GraphQL which makes it possible to design super fast sites, super fast.

JAMstack relies on technologies like Gatsby, Contentful, Netlify and many others, and runs sites of all types and sizes:

🛬 Landing pages: Formidable Labs

📚 The Documentation: React

💰 E-commerce: Flamingo

Performance and SEO are issues handled by default, which gives you time to take care of what really matters: your site.

More info on JAMstack.org (and in our meetups of course).

submitATalk.html:
Have an idea for a ​​talk?

Do you have an experience (good or bad) with the JAMstack you want to share?

Have you found a library, framework or SaaS you want to talk about?

You wrote / participated in an open source project related to the ecosystem?

Don't wait, offer a talk! We will be happy to help you in the choice of the subject, the preparation of the talk and the expression in public if you wish.

Propose a talk →
